title: Conservation Perspectives: Malangatana—Mozambique Modern
hero_caption: Malangatana Ngwenya next to the work with the title 25 of September II (25 de Setembro II), 1968
short_description: In preparation for the exhibition Malangatana: Mozambique Modern, an Art Institute conservator traveled to Maputo, Mozambique, to prepare and oversee the packing of 10 paintings and 24 drawings for shipment to the Art Institute of Chicago. Join museum conservators for insights into this complex and fascinating process.
list_description: Art Institute conservators discuss how they prepared works for the exhibition Malangatana: Mozambique Modern.
description:
In preparation for the exhibition Malangatana: Mozambique Modern, an Art Institute conservator traveled to Maputo, Mozambique, to prepare and oversee the packing of 10 paintings and 24 drawings for shipment to the Art Institute of Chicago. Join museum conservators for insights into this complex and fascinating process.

The Art Institute is the first major museum in the United States to host a solo exhibition devoted to Malangatana Ngwenya (1936–2011), one of the founders of modern African art and the preeminent artist of Mozambique.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.

If you have any questions about virtual programming please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu
